page.title: 18Communications in Aboyne
page.content: {Communications:} Aboyne has, for a country area, a good {bus service.} There are two bus routes Braemar to Aberdeen and Ballater to Aberdeen via Tarland. On weekdays there are 10 buses out from Aberdeen on the first route, 4 on the second route. Into Aberdeen there are 11 and 3 buses respectively,fewer on Sundays. There is a postbus which takes passengers, free, as well as mail. A post bus at 7 am goes round the delivery route Aboyne, Logie Coldstone, Dinnet, Aboyne. In the afternoon a post bus from Banchory through Aboyne collects mail at Post Offices up the valley to Ballater and returns by the same route. Aboyne has an automatic{telephone exchange.} Access to Aboyne is obtained by the A93 North Deeside Road, and B{roads } along South Deeside and to Tarland.
